  • Constructor Details

    • Level

      public Level​(java.lang.String fileName) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, LevelException
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      fileName - Name of the configuration file which has all the information of the level.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - When it is impossible to open the configuration file.
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When an error of this type happens, e.g. NumberFormatException.
      LevelException - When there is an error with the information of configuration file, e.g. incorrect size or min moves, no bunnies, no holes, #bunnies<#holes

  • Method Details

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Getter of SIZE.
      Returns:
      Value of the field "SIZE".

      public LevelDifficulty getDifficulty()
      Getter of DIFFICULTY.

    • getMinMoves

      public int getMinMoves()
      Getter of MIN_MOVES.
      Returns:
      Value of the field "MIN_MOVES".

    • validatePosition

      private boolean validatePosition​(int row, int column)
      Checks if the cell (row,column) is correct, i.e. it exists on the board. Row in [0,SIZE) and column in [0,SIZE).
      Parameters:
      row - Index of the row on the board.
      column - Index of the column on the board.
      Returns:
      True if the cell (row,column) exists on the board. Otherwise, false.

    • calculateRow

      private int calculateRow​(char letter) throws LevelException
      Given a letter, it returns integer index corresponding to the board.
      Parameters:
      letter - Letter that is required to convert into an integer.
      Returns:
      Row integer index corresponding to the board. The first letter is 'a'.
      Throws:
      LevelException - When the position does not exist on the board.

    • calculateColumn

      private int calculateColumn​(char columnChar) throws LevelException
      Given a letter that represents an integer, it returns integer index corresponding to the board.
      Parameters:
      columnChar - Index in char format that is required to convert into an integer.
      Returns:
      Column integer index corresponding to the board. The first char is '0' (zero).
      Throws:
      LevelException - When the position does not exist on the board.

    • isObstacle

      public boolean isObstacle​(Coordinate coord)
      Determines if the specified position (coord) is an obstacle that can be jumped over, i.e. bunny, mushroom or fox.
      Parameters:
      coord - Coordinate object that represents an object of the board.
      Returns:
      True if the position is occupied, false otherwise.

    • isObstacle

      public boolean isObstacle​(int row, int column)
      Determines if the specified position (coord) is an obstacle that can be jumped over, i.e. bunny, mushroom or fox.
      Parameters:
      row - The y-coordinate (row) of the position.
      column - The x-coordinate (column) of the position.
      Returns:
      True if the position is occupied, false otherwise.

    • getBoard1D

      public java.util.List<Piece> getBoard1D()
      This method returns a 1-D list with all the pieces which are on the board.
      Returns:
      1-D board in the format of a List.

    • getBoard2D

      public Piece[][] getBoard2D()
      This method returns a 2-D array with all the pieces which are on the board.
      Returns:
      2-D board in the format of an array [row][column].

    • getPiece

      public Piece getPiece​(Coordinate coord) throws LevelException
      Retrieve the piece which is in the cell "coord".
      Parameters:
      coord - Coordinate object with the information of the cell (row,col) where the piece is.
      Returns:
      Piece which is in the cell "coord".
      Throws:
      LevelException - When the coordinate is invalid for the board.

    • getPiece

      public Piece getPiece​(int row, int column) throws LevelException
      Retrieve the piece which is in the cell (row,column).
      Parameters:
      row - Index of the row in which the piece is.
      column - Index of the column in which the piece is.
      Returns:
      Piece which is in the cell (row,column).
      Throws:
      LevelException - When the coordinate/cell (row,column) is invalid for the board.

    • setPiece

      public void setPiece​(Coordinate coord, Piece piece) throws LevelException
      Sets the "piece" in the specific cell indicated by "coord".
      Parameters:
      coord - Coordinate object with the information of the cell in which the piece must be.
      piece - Piece to put into the cell indicated by "coord".
      Throws:
      LevelException - When the coordinate is invalid for the board.

    • isFinished

      public boolean isFinished()
      Indicates if the level is beaten/finished, i.e. all the bunnies are in a hole.
      Returns:
      True if the level is beaten/finished. Otherwise, false.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String with board's information.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      Text-based board.
